description_text:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Engineer at Air Apps, you will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes to ensure efficient data processing and analytics. You will work closely with data analysts, scientists, and software engineers to create scalable and reliable data infrastructure that supports business intelligence and machine learning initiatives.

This role requires expertise in data architecture, ETL processes, and cloud-based data solutions to handle large volumes of structured and unstructured data.

Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL workflows to support analytics and reporting.
Develop and optimize data warehouses and data lakes using cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Implement real-time and batch data processing solutions for various business needs.
Work with structured and unstructured data, ensuring proper data modeling and storage strategies.
Ensure data reliability, consistency, and scalability through best practices in architecture and engineering.
Collaborate with data analysts, scientists, and software engineers to enable efficient data access and analysis.
Automate data ingestion, transformation, and validation processes to improve data quality.
Monitor and optimize query performance and data processing efficiency.
Implement security, compliance, and governance standards for data storage and access control.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends, tools, and technologies.

Requirements

Around 4+ years of experience in data engineering, software engineering, or database management.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or Scala for data processing and automation.
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse, Snowflake).
Experience building ETL pipelines with tools such as Apache Airflow, dbt, Talend, or Fivetran.
Strong understanding of data modeling, schema design, and database optimization.
Experience with big data frameworks (Apache Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Flink) is a plus.
Familiarity with orchestration tools, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD workflows.
Knowledge of data security, governance, and compliance (GDPR, CCPA, SOC 2).
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills with the ability to handle large-scale data challenges.
Experience working in fast-paced, data-driven environments with cross-functional teams.

What benefits are we offering?

Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Annual Bonus.
Medical Insurance (including vision & dental).
Disability insurance - short and long-term.
401k up to 4% contribution.
Air Conference ‚Äì an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.
Transportation budget
Free meals at the hub
Gym membership

Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

description_text:
Title: Data Engineer
Duration: 12 months contract
Location: San Jose, CA
Work schedule: This is hybrid role, San Jose at least 3 days a week
Pay range: $58 to $65 an hour on W2

The Financial Data Engineer performs a wide range of job duties utilizing technical know-how and develop an analytics product that will generate insights into financial metrics and customer journey. Maintains a very hands-on focus for technology matters combined with an affinity for solving complex technical and business issues, enabling tools for self-service financial analyst community and delivering projects on time with very high quality.

Who you are:
You have the ability to work independently, prioritize individual workload, troubleshoot and remedy problems under pressing deadlines and with minimal need for escalation
You exercise good judgment and a pragmatic approach to delivering solutions that optimizes architecture activities across company needs, business constraints and varying technological realities
Document and demonstrate solutions by developing design documentation, code comments, presentations and code execution.
You are customer service oriented

Responsibilities:
Provide the creation of useful models to communicate current state, future state, and gap definitions in support of decision-making processes.
Consult in the refinement of existing models, adding new ideas to make the result more flexible and more tightly linked to current and expected requirements
Participates in project conceptual modeling, discovery processes, technical design/reviews, and project meetings in order to provide appropriate guidance that influences toward positive business outcomes.

Strong Python, SQL/PLSQL skills and big data technologies like Azure Databricks with enterprise data warehousing experience.
Strong data modeling and performance optimization skills.
Ability to design, develop, and migrate data analytics solutions by sourcing data from SAP HANA, SQL Server and other databases.
Experience working with analytics reporting for sales, bookings, finance, and subscription business areas.
Ability to design, develop, and test ETL solutions, including modeling data warehouse metadata and automating data loading processes.
Experience with Airflow or other ETL tools is a plus.
Experience with BI technologies like Tableau and PowerBI is a plus.
Experience monitoring, troubleshooting and tuning services/applications and operational expertise such as good troubleshooting skills, understanding of systems capacity, bottlenecks, and basics of memory, CPU, OS, storage, and networks.

description_text:
Role: AWS Data Engineer with SageMaker
Location: Reston, VA (100% onsite from day one)
Job Type: Full Time
Interview Mode: Virtual + In-Person (Client Round)

Job Description:
This role demands a strong AWS Data Engineer who can design and build end-to-end data pipelines and integrate them with SageMaker for ML workflows.
It‚Äôs not a Data Scientist role, but the engineer must know how to prepare, train, and serve data models using SageMaker.
Hands-on experience with Python, PySpark, Glue, Redshift, Lambda, Step Functions, and CI/CD is essential.

Core Technical Skills:
AWS Services: Glue, Redshift, Lambda, Step Functions, SNS, SQS, EMR, SageMaker
Programming: Python, PySpark
Data Pipelines: ETL design, orchestration, data quality & error handling
SQL Expertise: Query optimization, transformations, validation
DevOps/Automation: Git, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

Machine Learning Integration:
Must have hands-on SageMaker experience ‚Äî training ML models, deploying endpoints, automating retraining pipelines.
Integration of data pipelines ‚Üí SageMaker ‚Üí analytics layer is a key responsibility.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain ETL pipelines using Python/PySpark on AWS.
Implement event-driven and serverless data flows using Lambda, SNS, and SQS.
Integrate and manage SageMaker workflows for ML model training and inference.
Optimize and maintain Redshift data warehouse for analytical workloads.
Build automated CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure.
Collaborate with ML engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to align data flows.
Monitor and troubleshoot production pipelines for data quality and performance.

title: Senior Power BI Developer Data Engineer
linkedin_org_locations: London, GB
linkedin_org_description:
We are Ampa. The UK‚Äôs leading group of legal and professional services companies with a shared purpose; to unlock potential wherever we see it.

We always place our people and our clients first. We work with our talented people, recognised brands, market-leading partners and valued clients to fulfil growth ambitions and maximise potential.

At Ampa, we create opportunities and provide the infrastructure needed to enable and accelerate the growth of brands within Ampa.

We are proactively seeking mergers, acquisitions, team recruitment and lateral hires across all of our brands and welcome approaches from existing professional services business that share our ethos and values to get in touch about joining Ampa. 

If you would to join us or want to find out more visit: https://ampa.co.uk/contact-us/
description_text:
Senior Power BI Developer & Data Engineer

12month Fixed Term Contract

We have a blended work to your diary approach where we flex where, when and how we work, with attendance at our hub spaces 1 or 2 times a month ‚Äì as team meetings and client 

Join AMPA‚Äôs Data & Analytics team as a Senior Power BI Developer & Data Engineer, delivering enterprise grade analytics and data solutions across debt finance (DebtTrak/Aderant) and Peppermint CMS reporting. You‚Äôll work closely with our Data Manager & Fabric Administrator to establish a scalable, governed data platform, flexing between development, engineering, and modelling as priorities shift. The role is remote-first, with UK hub attendance for collaboration.

What you will be doing:

Power BI Development & Engineering

Lead the design, build, and optimise Power BI dashboards, reports, and semantic models for finance, debt, and operation teams
Engineer data pipelines using Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Dataflows Gen2, Pipelines) and Azure integration
Model data from DebtTrak, Aderant, and Dynamics-based CMS into governed, blended and scalable datasets
Implement incremental refresh, composite models, calculation groups, and performance tuning
Configure and manage Power BI workspaces, deployment pipelines, and access controls
Automate reporting workflows and enable self-service analytics for business users

Financial Modelling & Reporting

Deliver validated financial models and role-based reports for debt, finance and legal services
Integrate and reconcile data across multiple systems, ensuring accuracy and auditability
Lead the transition from legacy reporting (SSRS) to Power BI, embedding best practices

Platform Enablement & Collaboration

Champion the co-development of Fabric utilities, templates, and standards with the Fabric Administrator
Drive adoption of data product conventions, Git integration, and monitoring/logging for scale
Partner with Data Engineering, Finance, Legal Operations, and business stakeholders to mature the platform
Document solutions, create user guides, and contribute to a knowledge base for repeatability

Governance & Compliance

Embed GDPR, data protection, and least privilege access in solutions
Certify datasets, apply sensitivity labels, and maintain audit-ready documentation
Implement data quality checks, maintain data lineage documentation, and support audit readiness
Ensure robust security and compliance across all reporting assets

What you will need:

Skills and experience Must have:

Proven delivery of enterprise Power BI solutions (DAX, Power Query M, SQL)
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Dataflows Gen2, Pipelines)
Azure fundamentals (ADLS, managed identities, DevOps/Git)
Dimensional modelling, data product thinking, performance optimisation
Experience building financial/debt-related models and reports

Nice to have:

Domain experience with Aderant and Dynamics/Peppermint
Legal services data and finance process knowledge
Automation of testing and documentation
Microsoft Certified Power BI Data Analyst or Fabric Analytics Engineer

Key Competencies 

Strong analytical problem-solving skills
Ability to work with stakeholders across business and technical teams
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Collaborative and team-oriented approach
Ability to drive process improvements proactively
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving technological environment

Benefits, Agile Working And Additional Information

We embrace agile working and offer a blended approach to where and how we work.

We appreciate that people have different needs and preferences and we‚Äôre keen to be flexible, after all, we value what you do, not where you do it.

We have the following hubs across the UK: Birmingham, Bristol, Edinburgh, Leeds, Leicester, Lincoln, London, Milton Keynes, Nottingham, Sheffield, Solihull, Stratford upon Avon and in the South East; Brighton, Chichester, Crawley, East Grinstead, Eastbourne, Lewes, Peacehaven, Seaford, Storrington, Southampton & Tunbridge Wells.

Additional Information

Want to find more about our amazing benefits ?

Please be aware, for some vacancies, where we receive high numbers of applications we may need to bring the close date forward.

Due to the nature of the work undertaken, confirmation of employment will be subject to a variety of checks which will be carried out once an offer of employment is accepted. Details of the checks can be found here.

Equal opportunities

Ampa Group is a committed equal opportunities employer. We seek to attract, develop and retain talented people from a diverse range of backgrounds and cultures. We value and respect individuality and encourage a culture within our business where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths and experiences. Everyone who either applies to or works for the firm is treated equally, regardless of their gender, age, ethnic origin, nationality, marital status, sexual orientation or religious beliefs.

About Ampa Group

Welcome to Ampa - a leading group of legal and professional services brands, home to leading legal services firms such Shakespeare Martineau, Lime Solicitors, Mayo Wynne Baxter, Marrons and others.

Our ‚ÄòHouse of Brands‚Äô, is where legal and professional service brands converge to unlock exciting opportunities for career advancement, collaboration, and comprehensive business services support across various disciplines including HR, IT, finance, and marketing.

Our overall purpose is to act as the cornerstone that facilitates the growth of every brand within our collective, empowering them with enhanced purchasing capabilities, access to specialised expertise, and a cohesive set of values and culture.

At our core, we are dedicated to creating an environment where each brand thrives through mutual growth and co-operation. Through our shared infrastructure and central support, we enable our brands to flourish, using the strength of our collective resources.

If you are passionate about driving positive change and immersing yourself in an inclusive, diverse, and supportive culture, then we invite you to join our team as we continue to unlock the potential in our people, clients, and investors.

description_text:
We're working with a multi-manager systematic hedge fund managing over 20BN, who employs data teams to support trading pods; supporting their strategy development with data driven tools and platform.

This data driven ethos requires them to hire a Data Engineering Lead to build infrastructure for new Quant Researchers in multiple pods. Specifically, these engineers will be building pipelines and platforms for quant research data sets.

Stack: Python, AWS, S3, ETL 

They need an excellent Lead Engineer with a passion for data, and somehow who can partner with investment staff to enable them to maximize the usability of these applications.

If you would like to join a high performing tech driven trading firm, and get exposure to world class technologists and traders, then please do apply.

title: Data Engineer
linkedin_org_locations: 10 South Colonnade, Canary Wharf, London, London E14 4PU, GB
linkedin_org_description:
Nest was created to give people somewhere good to save for retirement. Today, we have more than 13 million members and 500,000 employers.

We‚Äôre for people, not profit which means that every decision we make puts your interests first.

Our team of investment experts takes care of growing your pension pot, so our members can focus on everything else.

üôå Together, we‚Äôll build you a bigger pension

Find out more at nestpensions.org.uk.
description_text:
Role Overview
As a Data Engineer, you‚Äôll work closely with stakeholders to develop, test, and maintain data products and solutions that align with their requirements. You‚Äôll be helping to develop a cloud-based data and analytics platform on Azure and help end-users integrate their workflows between this and other platforms, including AWS-based solutions. You‚Äôll combine data from different sources, and you‚Äôll build data pipelines to transform and organise raw data into formats that can be easily used for business intelligence as well as deep dive analysis and modelling.

Interviews will be face to face in the London office.

We are open to discussing working patterns.
We welcome all internal applicants to apply for our roles, regardless of your current working pattern or hours. We will aim to accommodate your request and match your current working arrangements.
Don't worry if you think you don't have all the key skills, it might be worth taking the few minutes to apply as we're good at spotting potential and offer a generous training budget.
Please download a full job description to find a full scope, deliverables, experience and personal attributes required for this role.
Reward and recognition
A discretionary bonus scheme
Reward and recognition scheme
Enhanced auto enrolled pension ‚Äì your contributions start at the default 5% while ours are higher at 8%. If you up your contributions to 6% we raise ours to 9%. If you contribute 7% or more we‚Äôll contribute 10%.
Income protection scheme ‚Äì is an insurance benefit that provides you with income if you cannot work due to illness or incapacity.
Click here to see the benefits we offer at Nest.

Flexible and agile working
Everyone's personal situation is different.
To make the most out of hybrid working, we've introduced different ways of working, which include (subject to role requirements):
hybrid of office (Canary Wharf, London) and home working (there will be an expectation to attend the office, once - twice a week, or more, as required) 
reduce or vary working hours
reduce or vary the days worked
work compressed hours
job share
For more information about our recruitment process click here -

Our recruitment process | Nest Pensions

Directorate/Department Overview
Nest is at the beginning of a transformation to use its data and insight to drive decision making, and Data, Analytics and Customer Insight is leading how we do it: putting our customers at the heart of our work and helping colleagues to understand and use our data. Our work enables Nest to continually learn, improve how we work and create value so that we can deliver a better retirement for millions.

The directorate includes:

* Business Intelligence ‚Äì starting with the data at source, delivering lovely data visualisations to make Nest‚Äôs data intuitive to understand
* Customer insight ‚Äì putting our customers at the heart of Nest ‚Äì understanding their needs through empathy, research, surveys, and digital insight
* Data ‚Äì planning and delivering how we manage high quality data as an enterprise, making it easy for BI, analysis and modelling to happen and be automated
* Partnership leads ‚Äì working with our new outsourced customer experience provider to make sure the right data & insight flows between the organisations from 2023
* Data strategy ‚Äì working on Nest‚Äôs data literacy, data governance, and a strategy for how we can all collaborate to make our data a really useful shared asset for Nest
* Analytics ‚Äì taking all our data and creating value for the organisation ‚Äì understanding our customer and our business, and doing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analysis and modelling to help Nest to make decisions
If you love data and insight, and you‚Äôd like to help us on this journey, come and join us.

Organisational Overview
Nest is a great government delivery success story. Established in 2010, Nest has been a critical pillar of the government‚Äôs automatic enrolment pension programme, with a public service obligation to accept any employer wishing to use the scheme to discharge their automatic enrolment duties.
Now with over 8 million members, our award-winning pension fund is tailored to members‚Äô requirements by combining extensive research and an expert understanding of their needs. First-class investment practice and governance are the backbone of our organisation. We invest responsibly and sustainably and are always transparent about the choices we make. It is both a privilege and a responsibility to help each of our members achieve the retirement they want.
It‚Äôs important that Nest has an equally diverse workforce and promotes an inclusive culture. This is in line with the organisation‚Äôs values and ensures that Nest is a corporation fit for the future.

title: Data Engineer
linkedin_org_slogan: Leadership hiring for GRC, Privacy & IT PM roles ‚Ä¢ Recruiting by real industry professionals ‚Ä¢ Contingent & Direct Hire
linkedin_org_locations: Atlanta, Georgia, US
linkedin_org_description:
Quality Choice Solutions (QCS) is a specialized staffing partner built by professionals who‚Äôve led from the inside. We understand the pressure of hiring for critical roles‚Äîbecause we‚Äôve done it ourselves. That experience drives everything we do.

We focus on sourcing and placing exceptional talent in 4 high-impact areas:

	1.	Privacy Consultants & Managers
	2.	Compliance Managers & Directors
	3.	Project Managers
	4.	Healthcare
	5.	Construction
        
These roles are vital in today‚Äôs fast-moving digital and regulatory environments, and we know what separates a good candidate from a great one.

Why QCS?
Because we speak tech. We‚Äôve hired, managed, and built successful teams in privacy, compliance, and project delivery. That fluency means we understand what hiring teams need, before they even say it, and what top candidates are truly looking for in their next opportunity. The same goes for healthcare.

We work with startups, growing mid-size firms, and large enterprises who need vetted leadership ready professionals who can deliver from day one. Our placements are targeted, thoughtful, and aligned with long-term goals, on both sides.

We also empower talent. Our candidate-first approach includes future-focused career conversations to align professionals with roles that match their aspirations and impact. Whether you‚Äôre ready for your next step or your next hire, QCS is the strategic partner you want in your corner.

Let‚Äôs build smarter teams, together.
description_text:
Position Details:
Title: Marketing Data Engineer
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days onsite, M‚ÄìW)
Duration: 6+ Months

Must Haves (highlight these in resume/sizzle):
Hands-on experience with Google Marketing Platform (DV360, CM360, GAM360)
Experience with The Trade Desk and social platforms (Facebook, Pinterest, etc.)
Strong understanding of campaign setup and pacing in these platforms
Data movement to/from marketing platforms (Azure + ETL)
Azure Data Engineering (2‚Äì3 yrs) and overall ETL experience (5‚Äì7 yrs)
Python and Databricks expertise
Ready for Day 1 hybrid work in Grand Rapids, MI

Job Description:
Design, develop, and implement data movement pipelines, dashboards, and analytical assets using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, ADLS Gen2, Power BI, etc.
Work with Google Marketing Platform, Salesforce MCI, The Trade Desk, and ADvendio for marketing data configuration and analytics.

Requirements:
6+ years of experience in data engineering / analytics / architecture
Proficiency in Azure (Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, ADLS Gen2, Power BI)
Experience in data pipeline design, ingestion, transformation, and automation
Working knowledge of Google Marketing Platform, Salesforce MCI, and The Trade Desk
Strong experience with marketing domain data ingestion and analytics
Proficient in Python and API integrations within Azure
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in CS, Engineering, or related field
SAFe certification is a plus

If you‚Äôre interested, please share the following details along with your latest resume:
‚úÖ Full Name
‚úÖ Work Authorization
‚úÖ Current Location
‚úÖ Willingness to relocate/work hybrid from Grand Rapids, MI
‚úÖ Availability for interview/start

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Engineer
linkedin_org_slogan: We empower digital talent to have great futures with leading companies
linkedin_org_locations: London, GB
linkedin_org_description: Norton Blake is a London based recruitment firm specialising in the sourcing of talented individuals.
description_text:
Data Engineer

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to design, build, and scale the data infrastructure that powers products and decision-making. This role is central to how data flows across the organization‚Äîfrom ingestion and processing to analytics and insights. You‚Äôll work closely with developers, analysts, and trading teams to ensure data is reliable, accessible, and built for the future.

This role combines hands-on engineering with strategic thinking. You‚Äôll contribute to architecture discussions, improve data pipelines, and help shape technical direction. We‚Äôre seeking someone who takes ownership, enjoys tackling complex problems, and can deliver impactful solutions across multiple systems and teams.

Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines for analytics, reporting, and product use cases.
Contribute to long-term technical roadmap and participate in architecture discussions.
Build and optimize ETL/ELT processes for small- to large-scale data processing.
Develop clear, well-structured data models and maintain documentation to support analytics and self-service.
Collaborate with software developers, analysts, and trading teams to deliver reliable and scalable data solutions.
Identify opportunities to improve performance, automate processes, and enhance data quality and reliability.

Core Skills & Competencies

Collaborative mindset: Works well with teams, communicates openly, and fosters a positive culture.
Analytical thinking: Structured, detail-oriented, and curious; focused on accuracy and performance.
Problem-solving: Able to trace issues across multiple systems and deliver elegant, lasting solutions.
Communication: Able to explain complex technical concepts clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Required Skills & Experience

Data warehousing: Understand differences between application databases and analytical warehouses; design models for both.
Python: Strong expertise; C# experience is a plus.
SQL: Comfortable with complex queries and query tuning on relational and analytical databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, ClickHouse).
Containers: Experience building, running, and deploying containerized services in local and production environments.
Cloud platforms: Experience with Azure and distributed systems.

Preferred Skills

Kubernetes & Helm: Deploying and managing containerized applications at scale with reliability and fault tolerance.
Kafka (Confluent): Familiarity with event-driven architectures; experience with Flink or KSQL is a plus.
Airflow: Experience configuring, maintaining, and optimizing DAGs.
Energy or commodity trading: Understanding the data challenges and workflows in this sector.
Trading domain knowledge: Awareness of real-time decision-making and trading data flows.

title: Sr. Data Engineer (NO H1B OR C2C)- Major Entertainment Company
linkedin_org_locations: 13101 Washington Boulevard, Suite 246, Culver City, CA 90066, US
linkedin_org_description:
The company was started by Raylene Baron and Veronika Zaitseva at the beginning of 1997 and we quickly established ourselves as valuable business partners for clients and candidates in the IT field.  Our company, based in Los Angeles, California, is privately held and woman owned.  We hold WBE certification.   

We pride ourselves in running a flexible, non-bureaucratic operation because really, isn't life is complicated enough?  We are here to improve the quality of your life whether you're in the pursuit of a new job or the perfect hire.

The business of search is as competitive for placement companies as it is for all of you IT professionals out there.  In order to keep our edge, we stay abreast of developments in technology and the industries we service (entertainment, media, music, financial, ecommerce, insurance ...). We also maintain excellent relationships with clients and candidates.  We are grateful to our loyal clients with whom we have worked since the first few years of our business, and to the clients that we have developed over the years.  Candidates become clients, clients become candidates - it all goes back to building and maintaining strong relationships.

We exploit technology and robust recruiting tools to help you with your search no matter where it is in the US.  It really is a small small world if you know how to navigate your way around it .... and we do.
description_text:
About the Team
The Ad Platform Decisioning and Machine Learning Platform team is part of a larger Ad Platforms organization, focused on improving advertising performance through machine learning and AI. The team develops large-scale, data-driven systems that power prediction, optimization, and decisioning across addressable ad platforms.
Bringing together experts in backend systems, big data, and machine learning, the team delivers end-to-end solutions that drive measurable results. If you‚Äôre passionate about high-impact engineering and cutting-edge technology, this is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the next generation of advertising innovation.

What You‚Äôll Do
As a Senior Software Engineer, you‚Äôll play a key role in building the next generation of experimentation and simulation platforms for advertising decisioning. You‚Äôll collaborate across engineering, product, and research teams to design scalable systems and deliver innovative solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
Design and build next-gen experimentation and A/B testing platforms to support evolving advertising needs.
Develop simulation platforms leveraging state-of-the-art methods to tackle complex ad delivery challenges.
Create scalable, efficient solutions for large-scale data analysis and processing.
Partner with data scientists and researchers to productionize machine learning innovations.
Architect and implement distributed systems emphasizing performance, scalability, and flexibility.
Champion engineering best practices ‚Äî CI/CD, code reviews, automated testing, and design patterns.
Contribute to the full software lifecycle: design, development, experimentation, testing, and deployment.
Collaborate with cross-functional partners including product managers, SDETs, and researchers in an open, fast-paced environment.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
Basic Qualifications:
4+ years of professional software engineering experience in Java, Python, Scala, or similar languages.
Proven experience developing highly available and scalable microservices.
Strong understanding of system design, architecture, and backend development.
Experience working with big data technologies and distributed data processing.
A proactive, innovative mindset with a genuine interest in understanding the advertising domain.
Passion for technology and openness to interdisciplinary collaboration.

Preferred Qualifications:
Domain knowledge of digital advertising or ad decisioning systems.
Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks and common tech stacks.
Hands-on experience with big data tools such as Airflow, Databricks, or Spark.

Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, plus 5+ years of relevant experience.

Project Scope
You‚Äôll contribute to ongoing projects within the Ad Platform organization, focusing on developing next-generation experimentation and simulation platforms. This includes online A/B testing for ad delivery and optimization, using modern backend and data technologies. No prior media or advertising background is required ‚Äî strong engineering fundamentals and curiosity are key.

Technical Environment
Backend: Java, Spring Boot
Cloud: AWS
Data: Python, Scala, Spark, Airflow, Databricks
Focus Areas: Backend microservices, data pipeline processing, API development
Candidates strong in either backend services or data processing are encouraged to apply ‚Äî a willingness to learn both areas is highly valued.
